comments:
I downloaded and installed emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-I200502240800.zip. I created a .ecore
file. I created some classes - selected one class (lets say "a" ) than I set in
the properties the "ESuper Types" to the class itself! ("a") and boom my
Eclipsed crashed and I could not restart because he always tried to open the
page again.

I set it to critical because Eclipsed crashed 

My log snip:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2005-02-27 17:30:23.937
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-02-27 17:30:23.937
!MESSAGE java.lang.StackOverflowError
!STACK 0
java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.get(BasicEList.java:498)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$EIterator.next(BasicEList.java:1169)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.ESuperAdapter.setFlags(ESuperAdapter.java:360)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.ESuperAdapter.setFlags(ESuperAdapter.java:362)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.ESuperAdapter.setFlags(ESuperAdapter.java:362)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.ESuperAdapter.setFlags(ESuperAdapter.java:362)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.ESuperAdapter.setFlags(ESuperAdapter.java:362)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.ESuperAdapter.setFlags(ESuperAdapter.java:362)
.....................

With classes I mean of course "EClass". 
The full scenario looked like:
File-New->Ecore model->
Model Object: EPackage and UTF8

Than I created some "EPackages" with "EClass" in a subpackage I select an EClass
and I got the exception listed above.

I'm changing the severity to normal since the problem is nasty but very easily
avoidable.  Critical means it's a show stopper for which no workaround exists...

Ok, but under the definition of severity is
"Critical  	crashes, loss of data, severe memory leak"
and I lost data and it crashed, but ok. Its just hard to avoid it in the first
place and its hard to to start eclipse again. But OK.
The choices are now filtered to prevent circularity.
